Current works

Statement

I've always loved looking at the shadows of trees on walls while sitting in my home. There's something that's calming about the way the dappled light filters through the trees. It's this feeling that I've tried to recreate in this body of work, inspired by the translucent quality of porcelain. Shadows come through porcelain in such a unique, diffuse way, much like sunlight gets scattered by the edge of a leaf. Here I show shadows from different parts of the day, frozen in time, from a morning routine til night. At night, we go from the outside projected inward, to the reverse of the inside being projected out.
